alert.note: Alert for Concordia; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:38AM CDT until April 05 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN TENSAS AND NORTHEASTERN CONCORDIA PARISHES... CLAIBORNE...JEFFERSON AND NORTHEASTERN ADAMS COUNTIES... At 538 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles east of Newellton to near Spokane, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Rocky Springs and Stampley around 555 AM CDT. Fayette, Reganton, Mcnair and Lorman around 600 AM CDT. Red Lick around 605 AM CDT. Blue Hill around 615 AM CDT. Mcbride around 620 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Ridgecrest. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for northeastern Louisiana...and southwestern and west central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
